thread.title: Majestic Princess is the new name for cruise line’s Chinese ship
thread.title_full: Majestic Princess is the new name for cruise line’s Chinese ship

title: Majestic Princess is the new name for cruise line’s Chinese ship
text: Majestic Princess is the new name for cruise line’s Chinese ship Majestic Princess is the new name for cruise line’s Chinese ship PRINCESS Cruises’ new ship will be called Majestic Princess, a sister ship to Royal Princess and Regal Princess. PUBLISHED: 14:48, Fri, Oct 9, 2015 | UPDATED: 15:13, Fri, Oct 9, 2015 PR Princess Cruises' new ship the Majestic Princess will set sail from Summer 2017 Majestic is being built at the Fincantieri shipyard in Italy and will be based in China year-round from summer 2017. It will be the first Princess vessel built specifically for Chinese guests incorporating a blend of international and Chinese features. “Royal Princess and Regal Princess were named after iconic previous vessels, while Majestic Princess will carry a name that was chosen by our global employees,” said Jan Swartz, president of Princess Cruises. “The name Majestic Princess is well suited to the Princess Cruises experience in China, and she will offer a truly magnificent experience to our Chinese guests,” he added. PR The revolutionary 'seawalk' aboard the new Majestic Princess ship Majestic Princess will also carry a Chinese name on the hull, Shèng Shì G?ng Zh? Haò, which means “Grand World” or “Grand Spirit” and was selected by Carnival plc’s China employees. The 3,560-passenger Majestic Princess will be home-ported in Shanghai for cruises to Japan and Korea, and will offer many of the features special to Royal Princess and Regal Princess. These include a multi-story atrium that will be the social hub of the ship, and the glass over-the-ocean SeaWalk that extends 28ft (8m) beyond the edge of the ship. It will also have the Princess Live! interactive studio and the special Chef’s Table Lumiere, a private dining experience that surrounds guests in a curtain of light. “We’re excited that Shanghai will be welcoming this newest, most advanced addition to the Princess fleet, as it represents our brand’s long-term commitment to the continuing growth of the China market,” said Swartz. Authentic southeast Asian, Japanese and Chinese menus will be added to the cruise line’s cuisine, which already range from Italian and French to North and South America. Every day, around the world, our guests create lifelong memories from authentic experiences while enjoying freshly made cuisine designed to bring each destination to life Jan Swartz, president of Princess Cruises Entertainment will continue to feature Las Vegas-style production shows, as well as dance, music and crafts of exotic cultures. “Every day, around the world, our guests create lifelong memories from authentic experiences while enjoying freshly made cuisine designed to bring each destination to life,” said Swartz. “Majestic Princess will allow us to bring the best the world has to offer to more Chinese guests, for an unparalleled premium and international vacation, inspired by our passion for the many places we sail.” Like all of Princess’ cruises in China, Majestic Princess will have authentic, events like the World Leaders Dinner and Traditional English Afternoon Tea; special culinary experiences such as the Lobster Grill; Ultimate Balcony Dining, with an ocean-view hot pot dinner option; and duty-free shopping featuring leading designer brands. The ship will also offer Princess’ signature Movies Under the Stars and the Princess Water Colour Fantasy fountain and light show. Related articles
